content.text: HTML Elements

❮ Previous
Next ❯

An HTML element is defined by a start tag, some content, and an 
end tag.
HTML Elements
The HTML element is everything from the start tag to the end tag:
<tagname>Content goes here...</tagname>
Examples of some HTML elements:
My First Heading
My first paragraph.

Note: Some HTML elements have no content (like the
element). These elements are called empty elements. Empty elements do not have an end tag!
Nested HTML Elements
HTML elements can be nested (this means that elements can contain other elements).
All HTML documents consist of nested HTML elements.

The following example contains four HTML elements (, ,

and

):
Example Explained

The <html> element is the root element 
and it defines the whole HTML document.
It has a start tag <html> and an end tag </html>.

Then, inside the <html> element there is 
a <body> 
element:

The <body> element defines the 
document's body.
It has a start tag <body> and an end tag </body>.

Then, inside the element there are two other elements:

and

:
The <h1> element defines a heading.

It has a start tag

and an end tag

:

The

element defines a paragraph.

It has a start tag

and an end tag

:
Never Skip the End Tag
Some HTML elements will display correctly, even if you forget the end tag:

codes.code:
This is a paragraph

This is a paragraph

content.text: However, never rely on this! Unexpected results and errors may occur if you forget the end tag!
Empty HTML Elements
HTML elements with no content are called empty elements.

The
tag defines a line break, and is an empty element without a closing tag:

codes.code:
This is a
paragraph with a line break.

content.text: HTML is Not Case Sensitive

HTML tags are not case sensitive:

means the same as

.

The HTML standard does not require lowercase tags, but W3C
recommends lowercase in HTML, and demands lowercase for stricter document types like XHTML.
At W3Schools we always use lowercase tag names.
HTML Tag Reference
W3Schools' tag reference contains additional information about these tags and their attributes.

data: Defines the root of an HTML document

content.text: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference.
